title: `spl_object_hash()` vs `spl_object_id()`
body:
<!--
Before reporting a BC break, please consult the upgrading document to make sure it's not an expected change: https://github.com/doctrine/orm/blob/2.9.x/UPGRADE.md
-->

### BC Break Report

<!-- Fill in the relevant information below to help triage your issue. -->

|    Q        |   A
|------------ | ------
| BC Break    | yes
| Version     | 2.10

#### Summary

After https://github.com/doctrine/orm/pull/8837, there are some UoW methods that the parameter has changed:

https://github.com/doctrine/orm/blob/81d472f6f96b8b571cafefe8d2fef89ed9446a62/lib/Doctrine/ORM/UnitOfWork.php#L3243-L3254

https://github.com/doctrine/orm/blob/81d472f6f96b8b571cafefe8d2fef89ed9446a62/lib/Doctrine/ORM/UnitOfWork.php#L3025-L3040

Because the OID is different, [at first I thought they were internal](https://github.com/doctrine-extensions/DoctrineExtensions/pull/2271#issuecomment-948600889), but apparently it is some kind of [internal notes.](https://github.com/doctrine/orm/pull/1334) 

#### Previous behavior

Before this, for calling these method you should generate the oid with `spl_object_hash()`

#### Current behavior

Now that oid is not valid anymore.

#### How to reproduce

Tests started to fail in https://github.com/doctrine-extensions/DoctrineExtensions

<!--
Provide steps to reproduce the BC break.
If possible, also add a code snippet with relevant configuration, entity mappings, DQL etc.
Adding a failing Unit or Functional Test would help us a lot - you can submit it in a Pull Request separately, referencing this bug report.
-->
